definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected

sentences.english: John has a windfall . It surprises his wife greatly .
sentences.chinese: 约翰意外获得一笔财富，使他夫人大吃一惊。

sentences.english: All participants must arrange their own personal accident insurance.
sentences.chinese: 參加者必需自行购买意外保险。

sentences.english: The accident of aortic cannulation is very dangerous and the mortality of this complication is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 主动脉插管意外极为凶险，死亡率非常高。

sentences.english: This is not terribly surprising, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这并非十分意外之事。

sentences.english: We all suppose that fossils are found by accident.
sentences.chinese: 我们都认为化石的发现纯属意外。

sentences.english: I have also been an expert witness at a tragic accident when a belay failed.
sentences.chinese: 我也一直是确保失败这种悲惨意外发生时的作证专家。

sentences.english: Yes, this is my overseas travel accident insurance card.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这就是我国外旅行意外保险卡。

sentences.english: It was rather high-handed to punish the child for the accident.
sentences.chinese: 因意外事件而惩罚孩子是相当粗暴的做法。

sentences.english: All our household goods are insured against accidental damage.
sentences.chinese: 我家所有的物品都投了意外损失险。

sentences.english: Han Yunzai explain it was an accident.
sentences.chinese: 韩云宰解释那是个意外。

sentences.english: Luo said he was shocked by the tactlessness of the suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 罗刚说，妻子家人的建议让他意外。

sentences.english: He accidentally trod on her foot.
sentences.chinese: 他意外走火打中了自己的脚。

sentences.english: There were other pleasant surprises, notably in rowing and roller-blading.
sentences.chinese: 同时划船和旱冰都得到了意外惊喜。

sentences.english: He discovered, by some accident, that flesh roasted in front of afire tasted better.
sentences.chinese: 他意外地发现，在火前烤过的肉尝起来更好。

sentences.english: It sets up an unnecessary contingency.
sentences.chinese: 它增加了不必要的意外。

sentences.english: They acquire wildness and some of the surprises that the wild entails.
sentences.chinese: 他们获得了野性，并因野性而获得一些意外和惊喜。

definition: not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
